- Filter by category (agents, RAG, prompting, etc.)
- Phases auto-hide when all courses filtered out
- Shows filtered count (e.g., "3 of 5 courses")

15 courses had only "specialization" category which didn''t match
any Q8 interest option, making them unreachable as electives.

Added appropriate secondary categories:
- NLP, ML, Math, DL specializations â†’ general
- GANs, TensorFlow, PyTorch â†’ training

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
refactor: Improve elective quality and fix course counts

1. Remove vestigial ''specialization'' category from all courses
   - Was a format descriptor masquerading as topic category
   - Type field already handles format (certificate/course/short)

2. Make Q8 course counts dynamic (was hardcoded, 7/8 were wrong)
   - Counts now calculated from actual course data
   - Will auto-update when courses change

3. Implement quality-based elective sorting (was array order)
   - Score = partner tier + type weight + depth (hours)
   - DLAI core courses prioritized, then major partners
   - Certificates weighted higher than short courses
   - Ensures best courses surface as electives, not arbitrary order

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
